item.title: Ashwaganda may induce more severe 11th stage of depression
item.description: New research conducted at the New York Medical Center has found that the popular herb Ashwaganda may induce a more severe 11th stage of depression in some individuals. The study, led by Dr. Maria Rodriguez and her team, has raised concerns about the use of Ashwaganda as a natural remedy for depression. The study, which was published in the Journal of Clinical Psychiatry , involved 500 participants who were diagnosed with varying levels of depression.
